event.title: were fired on-site, at the turn of the 19th and 20th centuries

data.event: Sharon is the location of the highest building in the southwestern section of the county, in the former Hill's Mercantile, made from bricks which were fired on-site, at the turn of the 19th and 20th centuries.
At the time of its merger in 1986 with the First Citizens Bank and Trust of South Carolina,it was the oldest continuously operating national in York County.

event.title: placed in the National Register of Historic Places in 2001

data.event: The Bank's distinctive architecture helped to get it placed in the National Register of Historic Places in 2001.
